page.title: 05HENSINGHAM POST OFFICE.
page.content: The sub-post office in Hensingham village is run by Mr and Mrs. Taylor.They live above the post office which also has a small grocery buisness looked after by Mrs.Taylor.Mr Taylor sells about 500 stamps a day, Â£5 being the highest value stamp he sells.The post office opens from 9.00am until 5.30pm.There are two employees but Mr and Mrs.Taylor clean the shop themselves.We visited the General Post Office in Whitehaven to compare the two. The main difference between the two is that a sub-post master is self- employed and is paid for the work he does.A general post master has a set wage. G.P.O. or Crown P.O. can supply people with passports,Vehicle Licences and Excursion Documents.All P.O.'s have a Girobank which is the same as a normal bank.
